intro: Moquilea longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. Moquilea longistyla is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
